title: Higher-Order Thinking Skills Improvement Program Using Business Simulation Games

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary science knowledge and professional fieldwork experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning conducted in digitally supported environments, emphasizing the acquisition of higher-order thinking skills applicable to professionals' real work contexts

learning_goals: Learners can analyze complex business problems within simulation games and make strategic decisions using critical/creative thinking

In game-based interaction platforms (e.g., Minecraft Education Edition), learners can form three-person teams to solve four science problem-solving tasks over two weeks, demonstrating collaborative problem-solving skills that meet at least four out of five cooperation criteria (communication, role division, feedback) in peer evaluations and observation checklists.
Learners can submit concrete outcomes (e.g., data analysis reports) demonstrating higher-order thinking skills through project-based assessments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
